abstract: In riffing on the multiple reasons that I'm enjoying the Republican nomination process as a supremely entertaining piece of transmedia storytelling, I made passing mention of Rick Perry's Unpopular Opinions, a one-topic Tumblr inspired by the Texas governor's ad titled "Strong."
lead_paragraph: In riffing on the multiple reasons that I'm enjoying the Republican nomination process as a supremely entertaining piece of transmedia storytelling, I made passing mention of Rick Perry's Unpopular Opinions, a one-topic Tumblr inspired by the Texas governor's ad titled "Strong." In that spot, Perry asserted that "you know there's something wrong in this country when gays can serve openly in the military, but our kids can't openly celebrate Christmas." The Internet found that argument laughably suspect, and in addition to making the YouTube version of the commercial one of the most "disliked" videos ever, responded with a barrage of interactive/remix mockery. The aforementioned Tumblr is a conspicuous example, and is made of up GIFs of the same self-assured, Carhartt-clad Perry from the commercial, captioned with phrases like " 'The Wire' was a dumb show" and "Kim Jong the Second was a humane leader."
